details.description: Use the farm self assessment tool to make sure you comply with farming regulations for cross compliance
details.alternative_title: Using cross compliance self assessment online
details.more_information:
The cross compliance self assessment tool helps you assess your farming practices so you'll:

* qualify for the Single Payment Scheme claim
* keep your land in good agricultural and environmental condition 
* follow statutory management regulations 

You'll need your County Parish Holding (CPH) number when you sign up.

^If you are an agent you can [sign up for Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra) Farm Surveys and Assessments.](https://secure.services.defra.gov.uk/wps/portal/wfa/!ut/p/c5/04_SB8K8xLLM9MSSzPy8xBz9CP0os3gzdx8LQyd_A0t3X3dHA08fM1fvAEdXY3cTI6B8JE55A3dDSnQbmBHQHQ5yLX7b8cmDzAfJG-AAjgb6fh75uan6BbmhEQaZAekAekimGQ!!/dl3/d3/L2dBISEvZ0FBIS9nQSEh/ "sign up as an agent for Defra Farm Surveys and Assessments"){:rel="external"}^

If you have any queries about the cross compliance assessment tool, contact the Defra Helpline.

$C

**Defra Helpline**  
<onlinehelp@defra.gsi.gov.uk>  
08459 33 55 77  
Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm

$C

You can find information about cross compliance in the guidance below.

$D
[Download 'Guide to cross compliance in England' (2012 edition) (PDF, 3MB)](http://rpa.defra.gov.uk/rpa/index.nsf/0/955c773ba3e93c868025796c0058eaad/$FILE/The%20Guide%20to%20Cross%20Compliance%20in%20England%202012%20edition.pdf "Download 'Guide to cross compliance in England 2012' (PDF, 3MB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[Defra]: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
